quotes.name: David R.
quotes.quote: It started with just some tingling in my feet. I ignored it for weeks thinking it would go away. Looking back, I wish I had acted sooner.

quotes.name: Maria S.
quotes.quote: The scariest part was not knowing what was happening. My symptoms kept getting worse, and every doctor had a different theory.

quotes.name: John K.
quotes.quote: Each day brought new challenges. First it was trouble with stairs, then buttoning my shirt became impossible. The progression was terrifying.

quotes.name: Susan M.
quotes.quote: I kept telling myself it was just stress or overwork. When I finally couldn't feel my feet properly, I knew something was seriously wrong.

quotes.name: James L.
quotes.quote: After months of tests and uncertainty, getting the CIDP diagnosis was actually a relief. At least we knew what we were dealing with.

quotes.name: Patricia K.
quotes.quote: The EMG was uncomfortable, but it finally gave us answers. Having a diagnosis meant we could start fighting back.

quotes.name: Mark R.
quotes.quote: Six different doctors, countless tests, and nearly a year before someone finally connected the dots. The journey to diagnosis felt endless.

quotes.name: Lisa W.
quotes.quote: Watching my husband go through test after test was exhausting. But each one brought us closer to understanding what we were facing.

quotes.name: Thomas M.
quotes.quote: Learning about CIDP was overwhelming at first. There's so much information to process, and you have to make treatment decisions quickly.

quotes.name: Sarah B.
quotes.quote: When my husband was diagnosed, we had to completely rethink our future. But we're taking it one day at a time.

quotes.name: Robert F.
quotes.quote: Finding the online CIDP community was a turning point. Here were people who understood exactly what I was going through.

quotes.name: Emily T.
quotes.quote: The hardest part was telling my young children. But their resilience and understanding amazed me.

quotes.name: Michael H.
quotes.quote: Starting IVIg was a game-changer. Yes, the schedule is demanding, but watching my strength return made it worth it.

quotes.name: Linda W.
quotes.quote: The first few infusions were intimidating. Finding the right infusion center and nurses made such a difference.

quotes.name: Daniel P.
quotes.quote: Learning to balance treatment schedules with work was challenging. My employer's support made it possible.

quotes.name: Rachel M.
quotes.quote: Physical therapy alongside IVIg was crucial. It felt amazing to regain control of my movements.

quotes.name: Robert C.
quotes.quote: Managing CIDP is like a full-time job. Between treatments, exercises, and monitoring symptoms, it takes constant vigilance.

quotes.name: Elizabeth D.
quotes.quote: The support groups have been invaluable. Sometimes just talking to someone who truly understands makes all the difference.

quotes.name: George H.
quotes.quote: Keeping a symptom diary helped me identify triggers and patterns. It's made managing flare-ups more predictable.

quotes.name: Carol T.
quotes.quote: I've learned to listen to my body. Pushing too hard isn't worth the setback.

quotes.name: William P.
quotes.quote: After two years, my IVIg stopped working as well. Having to switch treatments was scary, but sometimes change is necessary.

quotes.name: Karen M.
quotes.quote: The hardest part was accepting that my first treatment wasn't working anymore. But there are other options, and that gives me hope.

quotes.name: Alex B.
quotes.quote: Researching new treatment options was overwhelming, but my neurologist helped me understand each choice.

quotes.name: Michelle L.
quotes.quote: Switching to subcutaneous treatment was a big change, but the flexibility it offers has improved my quality of life.

quotes.name: Richard S.
quotes.quote: I joined a clinical trial because I wanted to contribute to finding better treatments. We need more options for future patients.

quotes.name: Jennifer A.
quotes.quote: The trial protocols are strict, but knowing I might help advance CIDP research makes it worthwhile.

quotes.name: Peter K.
quotes.quote: The research team explained everything so thoroughly. It helped ease my concerns about trying something new.

quotes.name: Sandra M.
quotes.quote: Being part of advancing CIDP treatment gives me purpose. It's not just about my journey anymore.
